page.title: 07PYECOMBE VILLAGE
page.content: There are about 25O people living in Pyecombe. The children attend Albourne Primary School then Downlands Secondary School, Hassocks, travelling each day by coach. About 3O families have lived here all their lives. 5 families moved in during 1985. There are no shops not even a post office. Close by at the junction of the A23 and A273 is Sir Speedy Garage which has been there for 2 years. Owned by Shell it sells petrol and employs 6 people. Another component deals in MOTs, tyres and exhausts employing mainly young people working 8 hour shifts. Averaging over 6OO cars a day and 2OOO at weekends, it receives about Â£2O,OOO per day, Â£7,OOO in cash and the rest on credit card. It is essential to the village as it is the only shop in the area selling bread, meat and toys. It opens on Xmas Day!
